alert.note: Alert for Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Northern Brevard Barrier Islands; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Brevard and northeastern Osceola Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Sharpes to Cocoa to near Lone Cabbage Fish Camp to near Holopaw. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Rockledge, Cocoa, and Cocoa Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
